Mikado.utilities package¶

Submodules¶

Mikado.utilities.dbutils module¶

This initializer contains the base declaration for all the DB classes of the module.

Mikado.utilities.dbutils.connect(json_conf, logger=None)[source]¶

Function to create an engine to connect to a DB with, using the configuration inside the provided json_conf. :param json_conf: :param logger: :return: sqlalchemy.engine.base.Engine

Mikado.utilities.dbutils.create_connector(json_conf, logger=None)[source]¶

Creator function for the database connection. It necessitates the following information from the json_conf dictionary:

  • dbtype (one of sqlite, mysql, postgresql)
  • db (name of the database file, for sqlite, otherwise name of the database)

If the database is MySQL/PostGreSQL, the method also requires:

  • dbuser
  • dbhost
  • dbpasswd
  • dbport

These are controlled and added automatically by the json_utils functions.

Parameters:
  • json_conf (dict) – configuration dictionary
  • logger (logging.Logger) – a logger instance

:rtype : MySQLdb.connect | sqlite3.connect | psycopg2.connect

Mikado.utilities.intersection module¶

Mikado.utilities.log_utils module¶

Module which contains all functions related to logging.

Mikado.utilities.log_utils.check_logger(logger)[source]¶

Quick function to verify that a logger is really a logger, otherwise it raises a ValueError.

Parameters:logger (logging.Logger) – the logger instance
Mikado.utilities.log_utils.create_default_logger(name)[source]¶

Default logger :param name: string used to give a name to the logger. :type name: str

Mikado.utilities.log_utils.create_null_logger(instance)[source]¶

Static method to create a default logging instance for the loci. The default is a null handler (no log)

Parameters:instance – the instance used to derive a name for the logger. It must be either a string

or a class instance with a __name__ attribute.

Mikado.utilities.log_utils.create_queue_logger(instance, prefix='')[source]¶

Mikado.utilities.overlap module¶

Mikado.utilities.overlap.overlap()¶

This function quickly computes the overlap between two ranges, with an optional flank.

Module contents¶

This module contains basic utilities for the suite, like e.g. database connection and log creation.

Mikado.utilities.grouper(iterable, n)[source]¶

Function to chunk an iterable into slices of at most n elements. :param iterable: :param n: :return:

Mikado.utilities.memoize(obj)[source]¶

Function to memorize the results of functions/properties in memory for fast access. Source: https://wiki.python.org/moin/PythonDecoratorLibrary#Memoize

Parameters:obj – the object/function to memoize
Returns:
Mikado.utilities.merge_partial(filenames, handle)[source]¶

This function merges the partial files created by the multiprocessing into a single sorted file.

Parameters:
  • filenames (list[str]) – the filenames to merge into the handle
  • handle (io.TextIOWrapper) – the handle to use for printing
Mikado.utilities.path_join(output_dir, output_file)[source]¶

Small utility to join together a directory path and an output file, checking first that the output file is not an absolute path.

Parameters:
  • output_dir – the output directory
  • output_file – the output file
